gen:link.label:label: Central Bank of Ireland: "The validation rule asssumes that the fully phased-in capital is lower than the capital with transitional arrangements. However, in the case of “unrealised gains on AFS assets”, institutions are permitted to fully recognise the unrealised gain for the fully phased-in definition of capital but they cannot recognise any unrealised gains for the current transitional definition for 2014 (i.e. the applicable percentage is 0% in column 50 of CA 5.1). The result is that Tier 1 capital under the fully phased-in definition is greater that Tier 1 capital under the transitional definition"
